unnormalised: ## Payment Gateways: Your Online Shop's Bouncer, But Less Scary (and Less Likely to Ask for ID)
normalised: ## Payment Gateways: Your Online Shop's Bouncer, But Less Scary (and Less Likely to Ask for I D)

unnormalised: So, you've poured your heart and soul (and a fair bit of hard-earned cash, maybe even selling Grandma's vintage sari collection!) into setting up your online store. You've got the snazziest website this side of the Yamuna, your product photos are Insta-worthy (even if your Instagram skills are still stuck in 2012), and you're ready to become the next Flipkart, right?

unnormalised: Wrong. You’re forgetting the gatekeeper, the digital doorman, the… payment gateway!

unnormalised: Think of it this way: you're serving up the most delicious, aromatic Hyderabadi biryani online. Customers are drooling, ready to devour it (digitally, of course). But how are they going to pay? Are you expecting them to courier you cash? Please, this isn't 1985.
normalised: Think of it this way: you're serving up the most delicious, aromatic Hyderabadi biryani online. Customers are drooling, ready to devour it (digitally, of course). But how are they going to pay? Are you expecting them to courier you cash? Please, this isn't nineteen eighty five.

unnormalised: Enter the payment gateway – that magical piece of technology that securely connects your website to banks and credit card companies. It's like the bouncer outside a Mumbai nightclub, but instead of checking IDs, it verifies credit card details and makes sure the money lands safely in your account. Less scary, definitely less likely to ask for your date of birth.
normalised: Enter the payment gateway – that magical piece of technology that securely connects your website to banks and credit card companies. Less scary, definitely less likely to ask for your date of birth.

unnormalised: Choosing the right gateway is crucial. Options abound – Razorpay, PayU, CCAvenue… It's enough to make your head spin faster than a dhol during Onam celebrations! You need to consider factors like transaction fees (nobody wants to lose a chunk of their profits!), supported payment methods (UPI, credit cards, net banking - the works!), and of course, security. Nobody wants their customer data leaking out like oil from a poorly sealed tiffin box.
